subject: Investing
title: HSA: The Triple-Tax Advantage
description: A micro-lesson that makes HSA: The Triple-Tax Advantage usable.

hook.text: A health savings account gave one saver a tax deduction, tax-free growth, and tax-free withdrawals.

buildup.text: HSAs are available with high-deductible health plans. Contributions are tax-deductible in full.

discovery.text: Investments inside the HSA grow tax-free, just like a Roth IRA.

twist.text: Withdrawals for qualified medical expenses are tax-free tooâ€”a triple tax advantage no other account offers.

climax.text: After age 65 you can withdraw for any purpose penalty-free; it just becomes taxable like a 401(k).

punchline.text: An HSA is the stealthiest retirement account in the tax code.

quiz.question: What makes an HSA 'triple-tax-advantaged'?
options: Deductible contributions, tax-free growth, tax-free medical withdrawals
